Recommend a non-statin lipid-lowering agent for patients on maximally tolerated statins with LDL-C levels ≥100 mg/dL

tables.baseText: Qualified respondents (those who passed the screener)
tables.userNote: (Select one)

tables.questionText: And to the best of your knowledge, which of the following best describes the current post-ACS guideline recommendation specific to lipid-lowering therapy?
tables.userNote: (Select one)

tables.questionText: How quickly might you expect to change your prescribing of PCSK9 inhibitors based on this indication change?
tables.baseText: Respondents whose prescribing in A4 differs from A3 for at least one PCSK9 therapy (Leqvio, Praluent, or Repatha).
tables.userNote: (Asked only of respondents who indicated their prescribing of PCSK9 inhibitors would change between the prior questions)

tables.questionText: State of main practice location (derived from ZIP code)
tables.userNote: (Derived from ZIP code)

tables.questionText: Region
tables.userNote: (Administrative: respondent region. Codes 1-4 are standard U.S. regions; code 6 indicates an invalid/missing region code.)

tables.questionText: Which of the following best describes where your primary practice is located?
How many physicians are in your practice?

rows.label: How many physicians are in your practice?

tables.baseText: Respondents with primary specialty of Cardiologist, Internal Medicine/General Practitioner/Primary Care/Family Practice, Nephrologist, Endocrinologist, or Lipidologist.
tables.userNote: (Numeric open-end response; summary statistics—mean, median, standard deviation, min, max—are generated downstream.)

tables.questionText: How many physicians are in your practice?
tables.baseText: Respondents with primary specialty of Cardiologist, Internal Medicine/General Practitioner/Primary Care/Family Practice, Nephrologist, Endocrinologist, or Lipidologist.
tables.userNote: (Binned distribution derived for readability. Bins are inclusive and chosen for analytical clarity.)

tables.questionText: If you would be willing to participate in future research to further elaborate on the responses from this survey, please indicate below:
tables.userNote: (Select one; 'Yes' indicates willingness to be contacted for follow-up research)

changes: <?xml version="1.0"?>

s5: labels, nets - Cleaned row labels to match survey answer text; added a multi-variable NET (_NET_S5_AnyAffiliation) combining S5r1–S5r6 (isNet with netComponents). Kept S5r7 (None of these) as a standalone row. Added userNote clarifying select-all behavior and that selecting any of options 1–6 would have screened respondents out during the screener.
s8: labels - Updated question text to the verbatim survey wording and cleaned row labels to match survey item text; kept as mean_rows (downstream summary stats will be produced).
s8_binned: added derived frequency table (isDerived=true) with sensible bins for each S8 item to aid interpretation given the numeric ranges in the datamap; sourceTableId set to s8.
tableId: s12, action: labels, description: "Cleaned row labels to match survey wording and removed redundant variable text; preserved variable names."
tableId: s12, action: no_change, description: "Kept as mean_rows. Downstream process will compute mean/median/std; no T2B or NETs applicable for numeric counts."
tableId: s12, action: userNote, description: "Added user note about autosum needing to be ≤ prior question (S11)."
description

a3: labels — Replaced technical datamap labels with verbatim survey wording for each therapy; questionText updated to full survey question (no numerical prefix). Kept as mean_rows to preserve mean/summary statistics.
a3: userNote — Added clarification that inputs are counts out of the last 100 patients and that therapy counts can sum to >100.

a3: derived — Created seven derived frequency tables (isDerived=true) that provide binned distributions (0;1-9;10-24;25-49;50-100) for each therapy variable to give analysts a view of the underlying distribution beyond the mean.
a3: surveySection/baseText — Populated surveySection using the survey's SECTION A heading and added baseText referencing qualified clinicians per screener.

a3a_leqvio_inclisiran_: Updated questionText to verbatim survey wording (removed system placeholder). Fixed row labels to match survey columns ('In addition to a statin', 'Without a statin'). Marked sourceTableId as 'a3a' and added baseText and tableSubtitle to reflect this is the Leqvio split. No NETs or T2B added (not applicable for mean_rows percent distributions).

a3a_praluent_alirocumab_: labels updated to match survey wording; clarified questionText; added baseText indicating this split is shown only to respondents who reported prescribing Praluent; added userNote about rows summing to 100%. No structural changes (mean_rows preserved).
a3a_repatha_evolocumab_: labels — Replaced verbose datamap labels with clean answer labels ('In addition to a statin', 'Without a statin').
a3a_repatha_evolocumab_: questionText — Rewrote question text to the survey verbatim (without number) and added instruction that rows must add to 100%.
a3a_repatha_evolocumab_: metadata — Set surveySection to SECTION A name, added userNote clarifying 0-100% and row-sum requirement, set tableSubtitle to 'Repatha (evolocumab)'.
a3a_repatha_evolocumab_: nets/t2b — No NETs or T2B applied (mean_rows percentage inputs). Table retained as a split per product.
"tableId": "a3a_zetia_ezetimibe_",
"action": "labels",

"description": "Updated questionText to the verbatim cleaned question from the survey; simplified row labels to clear, human-readable text; set tableSubtitle to 'Zetia (ezetimibe)'; set baseText to indicate this row was shown only for respondents who reported prescribing Zetia (A3>0). Kept as mean_rows (percent values)."

{ "tableId": "a3a_nexletol_nexlizet", "action": "labels", "description": "Updated questionText to the verbatim stem (cleaned) and simplified row labels to clearly indicate 'In addition to a statin' vs 'Without a statin' for Nexletol/Nexlizet. Preserved mean_rows type (numeric % 0-100)." }

{ "tableId": "a3a_nexletol_nexlizet", "action": "derived", "description": "Added two derived frequency tables with binned distributions to aid interpretation (5 bins: 0, 1-24, 25-49, 50-74, 75-100). These are useful complements to the mean_rows summary." }

{ "tableId": "a3a_nexletol_nexlizet", "action": "no_change", "description": "No exclusion applied; variables are numeric percentage ranges and useful. No NETs or T2B applied (not applicable for percentage mean rows)." }
a3b_leqvio_inclisiran_: labels — cleaned and shortened question text and row labels to match the survey wording; preserved variables A3br1c1/A3br1c2 (mean_rows).

a3b_leqvio_inclisiran_: metadata — set surveySection from survey, added baseText clarifying this split is for respondents who prescribe Leqvio without a statin, added userNote about percent range and that rows should sum to 100%.
a3b_leqvio_inclisiran_: analysis — no T2B/NET/splits applied (numeric percent variables; mean_rows). Table retained (not excluded).

tableId: a3b_praluent_alirocumab_ — action: labels. Updated the two row labels to match the survey wording ('Before any other lipid-lowering therapy (i.e., first line)' and 'After trying another lipid-lowering therapy').
tableId: a3b_praluent_alirocumab_ — action: split. Marked as derived split from a3b and set sourceTableId/splitFromTableId to 'a3b'.

tableId: a3b_praluent_alirocumab_ — action: metadata. Populated questionText with the verbatim question stem, added surveySection, baseText, userNote and tableSubtitle to clarify who was asked and that values are percentages (0-100).

tableId: a3b_praluent_alirocumab_ — action: no_change. Kept as mean_rows and did not add NETs, T2B or bins because this is a numeric percentage question (mean_rows); no additional rollups are appropriate.

a3b_repatha_evolocumab_: labels (cleaned to match survey text), questionText updated to full verbatim prompt (without question number), marked as derived/split from a3b, added baseText and userNote. No T2B, NETs or further splits applied because this is a mean_rows percent distribution (0-100) split for a single product.
a3b_zetia_ezetimibe_: labels — replaced long datamap labels with clean survey verbatim text for the two numeric items (Before / After).
a3b_zetia_ezetimibe_: questionText — clarified full question text (removed question number) to reflect that these are percentage distributions for treatments prescribed without a statin.

a3b_zetia_ezetimibe_: metadata — marked as derived (split of A3b), set survey section, baseText and userNote appropriate for mean_rows. No T2B/Nets/splits created because this is numeric percentage (mean_rows) with only two items.
a3b_nexletol_bempedoic_acid_: labels — Replaced truncated datamap labels with clear verbatim answer text from survey for both numeric rows (Before any other..., After trying another...).

a3b_nexletol_bempedoic_acid_: metadata — Set questionText to the verbatim A3b prompt (without question number), added surveySection, baseText clarifying the respondent base for this split, userNote clarifying percent format and that rows should sum to ~100%.

a3b_nexletol_bempedoic_acid_: no_change_to_type — Kept as mean_rows (numeric percent values). No T2B/NETs/splits added since this is a numeric (percentage) distribution and the table is already a per-treatment split.
a4: Found question in survey (SECTION A). Original combined mean_rows contained both LAST and NEXT 100 columns.
a4: Excluded original combined table and moved to reference sheet (split for readability).
a4_last100: Created derived mean_rows table for LAST 100 patients. Labels cleaned to match survey answer text.
a4_next100: Created derived mean_rows table for NEXT 100 patients (assumed indication change). Labels cleaned to match survey answer text.
Notes: mean_rows filterValue is ignored by downstream processing. No NETs or T2B applied (these are numeric counts per 100 patients).
a4a: labels — Cleaned and expanded labels to match survey text (mapped c1 = 'In addition to statin', c2 = 'Without a statin') and clarified product names.
a4a: no_change to tableType — Kept as mean_rows (numeric % of NEXT 100 patients). Added userNote about percentages potentially summing >100 across products.

a4a: derived — Created two derived comparison tables (a4a_in_addition_comparison and a4a_without_statins_comparison) showing mean % across products for the two metrics. Both are marked isDerived and reference sourceTableId=a4a.
a4a: nets/t2b — Not applicable for numeric percent mean_rows; no NETs or box-score rollups created.
a4a: exclude — Not excluded (question is substantive and varies).

a4b_leqvio_inclisiran_: Updated questionText to full A4b wording; fixed row labels to map numeric columns to 'Before any other lipid-lowering therapy (first line)' and 'After trying another lipid-lowering therapy'; left as mean_rows (numeric % 0-100). Marked as derived from a4b and added baseText and userNote. No T2B or NETs applied (not applicable).
a4b_praluent_alirocumab_: labels updated to match survey wording; questionText replaced with verbatim survey prompt (no question number).
a4b_praluent_alirocumab_: identified as mean_rows (numeric % 0-100) — kept as mean_rows and did not add NETs or T2B (not a categorical scale).
a4b_praluent_alirocumab_: added surveySection, baseText, userNote, and tableSubtitle to clarify context and that rows per therapy must sum to 100%.
a4b_praluent_alirocumab_: sourceTableId set to parent 'a4b' (this split is per-therapy). No exclusion applied.

a4b_repatha_evolocumab_: Found corresponding question A4b in Section A. Converted verbose datamap labels to clear human-readable labels for the two numeric columns (Before / After). Kept tableType as mean_rows (numeric percent variables 0-100). Added surveySection, baseText describing the subset, and a userNote clarifying that rows are percent distributions that should sum to 100% per respondent. No NETs or T2B added because this is numeric percent data (means/medians handled downstream). Treated as a split from parent table a4b.
a4b_zetia_ezetimibe_: labels - Replaced autogenerated datamap labels with clear survey text for 'Before' and 'After' columns.
a4b_zetia_ezetimibe_: questionText - Expanded and cleaned prompt to be verbatim survey intent (without question number).
a4b_zetia_ezetimibe_: tableType - Kept as mean_rows (numeric percentage 0-100); no binned distribution added since summary stats are generated downstream.

a4b_zetia_ezetimibe_: context - Set surveySection to SECTION A name, added baseText clarifying respondent subset, and added userNote about percent interpretation and that rows should sum to 100% per respondent.
a4b_zetia_ezetimibe_: source - Marked sourceTableId/splitFromTableId as 'a4b' (upstream split). No exclusion performed.
a4b_nexletol_bempedoic_acid_: exclude — Original combined mean_rows table (two columns: Before/After) excluded and moved to reference sheet. Split into two derived mean_rows tables for clarity.

a4b_nexletol_bempedoic_acid_before: labels — Created derived mean_rows table for A4br5c1 with clean label 'Before any other lipid-lowering therapy (First line)'; added surveySection, baseText, userNote, and tableSubtitle.

a4b_nexletol_bempedoic_acid_after: labels — Created derived mean_rows table for A4br5c2 with clean label 'After trying another lipid-lowering therapy'; added surveySection, baseText, userNote, and tableSubtitle.
a6: labels - cleaned and shortened item labels to match survey wording; removed variable-prefix text from labels.
a6: no_change to tableType (mean_rows kept) - mean_rows preserved so automatic mean/median/std-dev summary will be generated downstream.
a6_top1: added (derived) - created Top-1 comparison frequency table (one row per item; filterValue = '1').
a6_top2: added (derived) - created Top-2 comparison frequency table (Top 2 NET per item; filterValue = '1,2', isNet = true).
All tables: surveySection filled from survey header; baseText and userNote added to clarify ranking context.
a7: Found in survey. Converted long autogenerated labels to concise survey text.
a7: Added a multi-variable NET row (_NET_A7Any) to show percent selecting any option. Net components: A7r1,A7r2,A7r3,A7r4,A7r5.
a7: Marked as derived (isDerived=true) because of the synthetic NET variable.
a7: Added userNote '(Select all that apply)' and set surveySection to 'INDICATION AWARENESS, ALLOCATIONS & MONOTHERAPY PERCEPTIONS'.

a9_praluent_detail: created derived detail table for Praluent with 'Any issues (NET)' (2,3) and component rows.
a9_leqvio_detail: created derived detail table for Leqvio with 'Any issues (NET)' (2,3) and component rows.
a9_any_issues_comparison: created derived comparison table showing 'Any issues (NET)' across products for quick benchmarking.
User note '(Select one for each product)' added to all tables for respondent instruction clarity.
a10: labels - Cleaned up row labels to match survey wording and removed datamap prefix text.
a10: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_A10_AnyReason' combining A10r1-A10r5 to show percent who have prescribed PCSK9s without a statin (any reason).
a10: structure - Grouped reason items as components (indent:1) under the NET; left the 'Haven’t prescribed...' response as a standalone row (indent:0).
a10: userNote - Added note '(Select all that apply; responses can sum to more than 100%)'.

b1: Found in survey (SECTION B: CLASSIFICATION INFORMATION). Converted questionText to verbatim question without number prefix; cleaned and shortened row labels to match survey answer text. Kept as mean_rows (percentage). Added user note about sum-to-100.
b1: No NETs or T2B applicable for mean_rows percentage variables. Table retained as single mean_rows table; no splits or exclusions.

b5: Found in survey (B5). Updated row labels to match survey answer text; added a multi-variable NET row ('Any of the following specialties (NET)') with netComponents [B5r1,B5r2,B5r3,B5r4,B5r5]; indented individual binary-flag rows under the NET. Set questionText to the verbatim question and added baseText noting this was asked of primary care clinicians. Marked table as derived due to added NET.

s1: Found in survey (S1 consent). Updated questionText to full verbatim wording (removed numeric prefix). Fixed/truncated label for option 2 to match survey. No NETs or T2B applied (not a scale). Marked table as excluded because this is an administrative screener/consent question (moved to reference sheet).
s2b: Question text cleaned to remove prefix; labels verified against datamap/survey.
s2b: Added same-variable NET 'Clinician (NET)' combining values 1,2,3 to aid analysis; component rows indented under the NET.
s2b: Left 'Other' as standalone. Marked table as derived (isDerived=true). Set surveySection to SCREENER and added userNote '(Select one)'.
s2: Found in survey (SECTION S: SCREENER). Updated questionText to match survey wording and marked as frequency table.

s2: Kept original answer labels but added two useful NETs for analyst convenience: 'Physicians (NET)' (codes 1-5) and 'Advanced Practice Providers (NET)' (codes 6-7). Component rows were indented under their respective NETs.
s2: Left 'Other' (99) as a standalone top-level row because in the questionnaire selecting Other triggers termination; retaining it prevents misleading NET totals.
s2: Added userNote '(Select one)'. Did not exclude the table (important screener variable).
s2a: labels verified and aligned with survey/datamap; questionText cleaned to remove question prefix.
s2a: added surveySection 'SCREENER', baseText to indicate this is asked only of NPs and PAs, and a userNote calling out termination behavior for two response options.
s2a: no NETs or T2B added (categorical follow-up screener, 3 clean rows). Table kept (not excluded).

qspecialty: Found in survey (S2). No NETs or T2B added (categorical screener). Added user note '(Select one)'. Left as a single-frequency table.
s3a: labels - Verified and normalized labels to match survey. No NETs or T2B added (not a scale). Added baseText and userNote to indicate this question was conditional on S2=1.

s9: labels - Cleaned questionText to remove the question number prefix and matched labels to survey text.

s9: nets - Added two conceptual NET rows: 'Private practice (NET)' (values 1,2) and 'Hospital (NET)' (values 5,6,7) with component rows indented beneath each NET for readability. No synthetic variables were created; NETs use the same variable (S9) with combined filterValue.
s9: no_change - Kept remaining answer options and ordering consistent with the datamap (multi-specialty, Staff HMO, None of the above).
User note added: '(Select one)'.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>

s10: labels - Cleaned questionText (removed question prefix) and standardized the row label to 'Patients managed per month (count)'. Kept as mean_rows so downstream process will produce mean/median/std/min/max. Added user note about the screener (respondents with <50 patients were screened out).

s10_distribution: split - Created a derived frequency table (binned distribution) for S10 to give analysts a readable distribution view. Bins: 50-99, 100-199, 200-499, 500-999. Marked isDerived=true and used sourceTableId=s10.
s11: Found in survey SCREENER. Kept original mean_rows table and cleaned question label (removed question number from label). Action: labels, no T2B/NETs (numeric variable).
s11_dist: Added derived frequency table with 5 binned ranges to aid interpretation (10-24, 25-49, 50-99, 100-199, 200+). Action: split/derive (binned distribution).

a2a: Question located in survey and labels verified/normalized to match survey text; questionText trimmed to remove the question number prefix; added userNote '(Select one)'; no NETs or T2B applicable for this single-select categorical question; baseText set to indicate qualified respondents.
a2b: labels - Confirmed and preserved survey answer text; removed question prefix from questionText.
a2b: nets - Added a conceptual NET row 'Recommend statin-first approach (NET)' combining options 1 and 2 to highlight statin-first vs PCSK9i-first recommendations.
a5: Survey: Found - A5 located in Section A (INDICATION AWARENESS, ALLOCATIONS & MONOTHERAPY PERCEPTIONS). Type: Categorical single-select (4 options).
a5: Action: Removed question number prefix from questionText for clean rendering; verified and preserved the four option labels exactly as in the survey.
a5: Action: Added a meaningful NET row 'Within 6 months (NET)' (filterValue 1,2) to give analysts a quick view of near-term change; indented the two component rows (1 and 2) under the NET.
a5: Action: Populated surveySection, added baseText to explain who was asked (conditional on prior question), and added a concise userNote. No exclusions applied.
a5: Readability: Resulting table is 5 rows (including NET) and is scannable.
us_state: labels - Verified labels match survey/datamap and updated questionText to 'State of main practice location (derived from ZIP code)'; added userNote indicating derivation from ZIP.

us_state: no_change - Kept full list of states (including 'Other' and 'Invalid State'); no NETs or rollups created because this is administrative/geography data and the full categorical breakdown is required.

region: Updated questionText to 'Region'; retained datamap labels. Added a same-variable NET 'U.S. Regions (NET)' combining codes 1-4 (Northeast, South, Midwest, West) and indented those four rows under the NET for readability/analysis. Left 'Other' and 'Invalid Region' as standalone rows. Added userNote clarifying code 6 is invalid/missing.

b3: questionText cleaned to remove the question prefix; added a meaningful NET grouping 'Urban or Suburban (NET)' (filterValue: 1,2) and indented component rows for Urban (1) and Suburban (2). Kept Rural (3) as a standalone row. Labels verified against survey.
b3: No exclusion. surveySection set to CLASSIFICATION INFORMATION. No user note added (simple single-select).
b4: Found question in survey; preserved as mean_rows and updated questionText to remove the question number prefix and match survey wording. Label updated to match survey.

b4_binned: Added derived frequency table (isDerived=true) with 7 analytic bins (1, 2-5, 6-10, 11-25, 26-50, 51-200, 201-1000) to provide a distribution view for analysts. No NETs created. Not excluded.

qconsent: Updated questionText to remove variable prefix and match verbatim survey wording; confirmed labels match survey (Yes/No). Added user note clarifying meaning. No T2B, NETs, splits or exclusions applied.
